column4: anybody got experience (or has info on) setting up virtual ftp users in ubuntu / proftp environment?
okay, and this is for a virtual domain?
so what do you want to do? make it so the user only has access to his/her files and not the rest of the system?
just chsh his shell to /bin/false, change his home directory to his apache directory (where he can upload/download his web files), and add the following to your proftpd.conf:  DefaultRoot ~
restart proftpd and that should take care of it
you will need to change the DefaultRoot from /var/www to ~
> there's other users, unix users, who have to ftp into the machine and be able to access all of /var/www
well unless you have some virtual domains, then that will echo for everyone
the problem, however, is that proftpd is IP-based, as it is a limitation of the ftp protocol itself
as long as your virtual domains reside on their own IP and they're not sharing the same IP together, then it will work.
> i might be asking for a little too much :)
you *CAN* limit who can and cannot login to the domain...
and it's all done in the same config file
> that doesn't help - it controls the reverse of what i need to; johnny needs full access to his subdirectory... and only to his subdir
you still haven't answered if the virtual domain has its own IP or not - that's the deciding factor

okay, then it's possible - just set the virtual domain ip to limit access to only the user johnny and default his root to ~, it should remain independent of the other unix users, just make sure you set it all in the <VirtualHost> directive
